hi Jean-Noel,

Ok, i think i found the problem.

when you create a new shee=
t

   Add Single Sheet ... [my-new-sheet]

and click Submit, you drop right=
 into

   Settings for sheet "my-new-sheet":

then, if you jump right down =
to:

   root:scope:rules

and select (list of DecideRule>>details), you get=
:

   (!) You cannot edit this setting because it hasn't been added
       =
to the sheet yet.

so, you go back and select (list of DecideRule >>add).
y=
our sheet appears in dim color along with "global" next to
rules:

   "rule=
s my-new-sheet global"

then, you select (list of DecideRule>>details), and=
 a
whole bunch of Elements appear which you never actually
added to your ne=
w sheet. it looks like their coming from
the global sheet.

so, when you tr=
y to change the order of the DecideRules,
an exception is thrown by Setting=
sList.swap() because
the list in scope is empty.

this happens in local cra=
wl engines as well as remotely
managed (JMX) ones.

WORKAROUND

in order to=
 avoid this condition, be sure to add elements
hierarchically before attemp=
ting to view or make changes
to their details.

so, to change the order of =
DecideRules for instance,

   Add Single Sheet ... [my-new-sheet]
   Settin=
gs for sheet "my-new-sheet":
   root map of Object >>add
     scope [Create=
 DecideRuleSequence] >>add
       rules
       list of DecideRule >>add

th=
en, Add New Element(s), and change their order as desired.

PROPOSED FIX

c=
heck for empty list in SheetManager.moveElement(), and
other methods that m=
ight miss this condition.

i'll open an issue for this in JIRA, and impleme=
nt the fix.

thanks again, for finding another bug.



/steve@...

=
